program main

    implicit none

    integer :: n, m, i, sub, test

    integer, allocatable :: a(:)

    character(len=10) :: temp_str

children.label: language_mapping

children.text:
Read input

    read*, n, m

    allocate(a(m))

    ! Compute array a

    if (mod(n, m) == 0) then

        a = n/m

    else

        sub = n/m

        a = sub

        test = n - sub*m do i = 1, test

            a(i) = a(i) + 1

        end do

    end if

    ! Build the string s

    s = ''

    do i = m, 1, -1

        write(temp_str, '(i0)') a(i)

        s = trim(s) // trim(temp_str) // ' '

    end do

    ! Process the string through second program's logic

    a_str = s

    b_str = s

    a1 = 0

    a2 = 0

    ! Process a_str do i = 2, len_trim(a_str)

        if (a_str(i:i) == a_str(i-1:i-1)) then

            if (a_str(i:i) == '1') then

                a_str(i:i) = '0'

            else

                a_str(i: i) = '1'

            end if

            a1 = a1 + 1

        end if

    end do

    ! Process b_str

    do i = len_trim(b_str), 2, -1

        if (b_str(i:i) == b_str(i-1:i-1)) then

            if (b_str(i-1:i-1) == '1') then

                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '0'

            else

                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '1'

            end if

            a2 = a2 + 1

        end if

    end do

    ! Output the result

    print*, min(a1, a2)

end program main

Putting all together, the code would be:

program main

    implicit none

    integer :: n, m, i, sub, test

    integer, allocatable :: a(:)

    character(len=1000) :: s, a_str, b_str

    integer :: a1, a2

    character(len=10) :: temp_str

    ! Read input

    read*, n, m

    allocate(a(m))

    ! Compute array a

    if (mod(n, m) == 0) then

        a = n/m

    else

        sub = n/m

        a = sub

        test = n - sub*m

        do i = 1, test

            a(i) = a(i) + 1

        end do

    end if

    ! Build the string s

    s = ''

    do i = m, 1, -1

        write(temp_str, '(i0)') a(i)

        s = trim(s) // trim(temp_str) // ' '

    end do

    ! Process the string through second program's logic

    a_str = s

    b_str = s

    a1 = 0

    a2 = 0

    ! Process a_str

    do i = 2, len_trim(a_str)

        if (a_str(i:i) == a_str(i-1:i-1)) then

            if (a_str(i:i) == '1') then

                a_str(i:i) = '0'

            else

                a_str(i:i) = '1'

            end if

            a1 = a1 + 1

        end if

    end do

    ! Process b_str

    do i = len_trim(b_str), 2, -1

        if (b_str(i:i) == b_str(i-1:i-1)) then

            if (b_str(i-1:i-1) == '1') then

                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '0'

            else

                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '1'

            end if

            a2 = a2 + 1

        end if

    end do

    ! Output the result

    print*, min(a1, a2)

end program main
